word_mean: 核，仁：原子除去价电子后剩下的部分

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cyrnel, diminutive of corn

entry.def: The kernel of a nut is the part that is inside the shell.
The kernel of something is the central and most important part of it.

example.ex: The kernel of that message was that peace must not be a source of advantage or disadvantage for anyone.
example.tran: 那一信息的核心是和平绝不应该成为对任何人有利或不利的根源。

entry.def: A kernel of something is a small element of it.

example.ex: For all I know, there may be a kernel of truth in what he says.
example.tran: 据我所知，他的话可能有一点儿道理。

means.word_mean: 1. the inner and usually edible part of a seed or grain or nut or fruit stone;

sentences.sentence: "black walnut kernels are difficult to get out of the shell"

means.word_mean: 2. a single whole grain of a cereal;
3. the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience;

sentences.sentence: "the heart and soul of the Republican Party"

auth_sentence.content: It is the kernel of what people do in those disciplines.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is the kernel of what people do in those disciplines.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is the kernel of what people do in those disciplines.

auth_sentence.content: That is the kernel of a good answer to the question.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is the kernel of a good answer to the question.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is the kernel of a good answer to the question.

auth_sentence.content: Anxiety contains a kernel of hope.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Anxiety contains a kernel of hope.

means.word_mean: （思想或主题的）要点, 中心, 核心

sentences.en: The kernel of his problem is lack of money.
sentences.cn: 他的问题的核心是缺钱。
